title: Strictly’s AJ Pritchard ‘upset’ after nightclub assault case is ‘discontinued’
text:
AJ and Curtis were horrifically attacked last December (Picture: ITV, Rex Features)

Strictly Come Dancing star AJ Pritchard is said to be ‘very upset’ after the investigation into his nightclub assault was ‘discontinued’.

The 24-year-old dancer and his Love Island star brother, Curtis Pritchard, were viciously attacked by thugs at the Nakatcha nightclub in Nantwich on 27 December 2018.

Now almost 10 months later, the case has been closed.

A spokesperson for Cheshire Police told The Sun: ‘Officers have carried out numerous enquiries.

‘As a result, a 21-year-old man was arrested and charged with assault. However, the case against him has since been discontinued at a magistrates’ court.’

The development is said to have disappointed AJ, who has hoped his attackers would be brought to justice.

A friend of the Strictly star reportedly told Sunday People: ‘He’s very upset. He feels justice has not been served. He’s been the victim of a violent crime and nothing has been done.’

The pair suffered multiple injuries (Picture: ITV, Rex Features)

The brothers went on to have a pretty stellar 2019 (Picture: Getty Images)

The attack injured both brothers with AJ suffering bruising to his face, arms, body and legs, while Curtis underwent surgery to correct knee damage.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Recalling the horrific incident, Curtis said on This Morning in January: ‘I can only say perhaps it was jealousy, because AJ was doing a couple of photos with people. He’s a good looking lad. I was the one getting asked to take the photos, which is fine.’

AJ added: ‘If someone comes up to me and asks me for a photo, if they do it politely, I’m always going to say yes.

‘The really sad thing in this scenario was that we were just out to have a good time, and it came from nowhere. There was none of us in the first place causing a hassle or anything, we were not there for that scenario, that’s what is really sad for us.’

Following their ordeal, the Pritchard brothers have enjoyed a pretty stellar 2019 with AJ returning to this series’ Strictly Come Dancing, and Curtis becoming a star in his own right after appearing on Love Island this summer.

description: Strictly Come Dancing star AJ Pritchard is said to be 'very upset' that the investigation into the assault against him has closed.
